course.post_content:
• Learn from WordPress developers who are expert in their field and passionate about teaching.
  • Ask questions and get direct feedback and support from course instructors and Academy staff.
  • Study along with a like-minded cohort. Make friends and explore opportunities for collaboration.
  • Weekly discussions allow you to share and discuss your work with instructors and other students.
  • Complete courses and receive comprehensive feedback on your assignments from instructors.
  • Each course is fully assessed by Academy staff and when you graduate you will receive full certification.

“If the WordPress Customizer were a body builder, Upfront would be Iron Man and Superman combined. It's intuitive to use for beginners, but also packed with features that are perfect for developers and agencies. It's just plain fun to use and also happens to be my new pastime.”
- Jenni McKinnon, Course Instructor
course.post_excerpt:
Drag, scale, position, customize and see every edit you make to your WordPress website on the front-end – in real-time – with Upfront.

In this five-part course, learn how to use the Upfront theme framework with fun lessons and practical examples you can try out on our demo website. By the end of the course, you’ll have solid experience in editing themes and will have your own stunning Upfront website.

cp_course_subtitle: Learn how to create beautiful websites with WPMU DEV’s powerful theme framework.
cp_pre_completion_content:
You've uploaded your final assignment – nice work!

Congratulations on completing all the requirements course work for Introduction to Upfront! Now it’s my turn to review your work and assess your learning for this course. You’ll hear back from me soon with your final grade.

In the meantime, why not enroll in another Academy course? We have new courses always open for enrollment. Head back to The Academy homepage to see which courses are available.

- Jenni McKinnon, Course Instructor
cp_course_completion_content: Woohoo! You've passed Introduction to Upfront! Give yourself a pat on the back – you're now on your way to becoming a hardcore Upfront developer. Becoming competent with Upfront doesn't stop here. Now that you've completed this course, why not enroll in one of our other courses? Head over to The Academy homepage to see which courses are available. All the best with building websites with Upfront! The theme framework has quickly become my favorite tool for developing websites with WordPress. I hope this course has opened your eyes to the infinite possibilities that come with building websites with Upfront. - Jenni McKinnon, Course Instructor
cp_course_failed_title: Sorry, you did not pass this course!
cp_course_failed_content: I'm sorry to say you didn't pass Introduction to Upfront. Better luck next time! Don't be discouraged! You can have another go at completing this course. Head over to The Academy homepage to enrol again, or check out our other courses on offer All the best with your Upfront learning! - Daniel Pataki, Course Instructor

page_description:
O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:6:"page_1";s:2399:"

Upfront is a theme framework for WordPress that allows you to drag and drop, scale, position, customize and see every edit you make to your website as you make it in real-time.

But what does that mean exactly? I like how WebDesignerDepot’s review explains Upfront:

"Upfront is, technically a WordPress theme, in the same way that a T-Rex is technically a lizard. In reality, it’s a whole lot more than that: Upfront allows you to customize your site — not just the content, the design too — without ever logging into the WordPress dashboard.”

There are a lot of page builders for WordPress, like Headway, Pagelines, Divi and iThemes Builder. So how is Upfront any different?

Upfront makes customizing the design of your site so easy you’ll never need another WordPress theme.

In this five-part course, I’ll introduce you to Upfront, walk you through how to use it with some fun examples you can try out for yourself on our Upfront demo site and, hopefully, open your eyes to the infinite possibilities that come with building websites with Upfront.

"I find it difficult to believe there is a particular layout that can’t be created with Upfront.” Chris Lema, WordPress blogger

Let’s get started!

Note: Before you get started, keep in mind that if you run into problems with any of the steps below it's best to refer to our Upfront Docs for comprehensive instructions. This course is a getting started guide so we're introducing you to how the framework works so you can start editing your own websites right away.

";s:6:"page_2";s:338:"

In order to complete this unit, Getting Started, read through the tutorial, watch the video, do the homework, and then complete the multiple choice quiz.

If you have any questions or thoughts about the course material, feel free to chat with fellow students and course facilitators in the unit discussion.

Good luck!

";s:6:"page_3";s:576:"At the end of each unit, you are required to complete a multiple choice quiz based on the concepts you learned about in the tutorial and video. You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course. If you find the quiz tough, it's because we've made it deliberately challenging – we want you to think about what you've learned (and really earn the certificate at the end of the course!). Each of the questions is based on what's been covered in the course material so if you've paid attention you should have no problems. Good luck!";}

1.title: Tasks
1.description:
In order to complete this unit, Getting Started, read through the tutorial, watch the video, do the homework, and then complete the multiple choice quiz.

If you have any questions or thoughts about the course material, feel free to chat with fellow students and course facilitators in the unit discussion.

Good luck!

2.title: Assessment
2.description:
At the end of each unit, you are required to complete a multiple choice quiz based on the concepts you learned about in the tutorial and video. You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course.

If you find the quiz tough, it's because we've made it deliberately challenging – we want you to think about what you've learned (and really earn the certificate at the end of the course!). Each of the questions is based on what's been covered in the course material so if you've paid attention you should have no problems.

Good luck!

1.title: Tasks
1.description:
In order to complete this unit, Getting Started, read through the tutorial, watch the video, do the homework, and then complete the multiple choice quiz.

If you have any questions or thoughts about the course material, feel free to chat with fellow students and course facilitators in the unit discussion.

Good luck!

2.title: Assessment
2.description:
At the end of each unit, you are required to complete a multiple choice quiz based on the concepts you learned about in the tutorial and video. You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course.

If you find the quiz tough, it's because we've made it deliberately challenging – we want you to think about what you've learned (and really earn the certificate at the end of the course!). Each of the questions is based on what's been covered in the course material so if you've paid attention you should have no problems.

Good luck!

questions.question: What are the options for downloading Upfront? (Select all that apply)

answers: Download an Upfront starter theme directly from the WPMU DEV website and upload it to your WordPress site
Download Upfront from the WordPress.org Theme Directory
Download the WPMU DEV Dashboard plugin and auto-install an Upfront starter theme from the backend of your site
Login to WordPress.com and download Upfront from the themes available

questions.question: How do you access the Upfront Editor? (Select all that apply)

answers: The editor loads right away when you login into your WordPress site
In the WordPress admin, go to Appearance > Customize
Go to Appearance > Themes in the backend of your site and click Customize on your chosen theme
Click Upfront in the toolbar at the top of the WordPress admin

questions.question: Why are Upfront theme images pixelated?

answers: To ensure file sizes are small and the editor loads fast
Because the original images need to be censored
Because we need to protect the identities of the people in the photos

questions.question: How do you resize an image in Upfront?

answers: Double-click on the image and it will automatically resize to your desired size
Go to the Theme Settings in the sidebar and edit the CSS
Hover over an image, click one of the white handles that appear on the left, right and bottom, and drag to your desired size

questions.question: How do you open the text editing toolbar?

answers: Close Upfront and in the WordPress admin open go to Posts > Add New
Click and drag a text element onto your site

questions.question: How do you return to the WordPress admin when you’ve finished using the Upfront editor?

answers: Click on the Upfront logo in the sidebar
Click the three dots next to the Upfront logo at the top of the sidebar

questions.question: How do you drag and drop an element?

answers: Hover over an element, click twice
Click an element and drop it like it's hot
Click on an element in the sidebar, hold and drag it, and drop it anywhere on the page
Click on an element in the sidebar and then let go

questions.question: Which element would you use to create a new slider?
Which of these are Upfront Starter themes? (Select all that apply)
How do you reset your Upfront theme?

answers: Try turning it off and on again
In the WordPress admin, go to Appearance > Themes and activate a different theme
In the WordPress admin, go to Upfront > General and click Reset Theme

questions.question: What are regions?

answers: The backgrounds you can add to pages of your site to create headers, footers, and sections for your content.
Elements provide the core functionality for your site, everything from basic text areas and images to galleries, Google Maps and sliders.
Spaces you can create for displaying galleries

questions.question: What are elements?

answers: The backgrounds you can add to pages of your site to create headers, footers, and sections for your content.
Elements provide the core functionality for your site, everything from basic text areas and images to galleries, Google Maps and sliders.

questions.question: How many elements are there?
If you wanted to add custom code to your page, which element would you use?
How do you add a spacer around an element?

answers: Go to the settings of the element by clicking the gear icon.
Resize an element to add a spacer or hover over the area where two elements meet to reveal a + button you can click to add a spacer.
Hover over an existing region and click the red X icon in the top-right corner.
Click and drag a new element to the page

questions.question: If you wanted to add a map to your page, which element would you use?
Are parallax backgrounds possible with Upfront?
Can you add slider backgrounds when editing Upfront themes?

meta_questions.question: What are regions?

How do you add a spacer around an element?

answers: Go to the settings of the element by clicking the gear icon.
Resize an element to add a spacer or hover over the area where two elements meet to reveal a + button you can click to add a spacer.
Hover over an existing region and click the red X icon in the top-right corner.
Click and drag a new element to the page

meta_questions.question: If you wanted to add a map to your page, which element would you use?
Are parallax backgrounds possible with Upfront?
Can you add slider backgrounds when editing Upfront themes?

1.title: Tasks
1.description:
In order to complete this unit, Pages, Posts and Responsive, read through the tutorial, watch the video, do the homework, and then complete the multiple choice quiz.

If you have any questions or thoughts about the course material, feel free to chat with fellow students and course facilitators in the unit discussion.

Good luck!

2.title: Assessment
2.description:
At the end of each unit, you are required to complete a multiple choice quiz based on the concepts you learned about in the tutorial and video. You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course.

If you find the quiz tough, it's because we've made it deliberately challenging – we want you to think about what you've learned (and really earn the certificate at the end of the course!). Each of the questions is based on what's been covered in the course material so if you've paid attention you should have no problems.

Good luck!

answers: Titles, dates, categories, tags, feature images etc

questions.question: Presets are:

answers: A way to create uniform styles for elements across your site, i.e. the same style for all of your buttons, forms, galleries etc.
A way to add custom CSS to your website
The only way to style regions

questions.question: You can find preset settings under which tab when accessing an element's settings?
What is a default preset?

answers: An empty preset with no styling or CSS
An inherent preset that comes with a theme

questions.question: It is recommended that you create a new preset instead of editing the default preset.
You can both create and edit a preset by first clicking the "Choose or Create Preset" drop down box under the Appearance tab.
All but four of Upfront’s 16 elements can be given preset styles. Which ones can’t you apply presets to?
You can choose to reset or delete a preset you created.
Where can you apply custom CSS in Upfront?
To add custom CSS for elements, click the Edit Preset CSS button under the Appearance tab.
You can choose to add custom CSS or style a preset with the available options, but not both.

meta_questions.question: Presets are:

answers: A way to create uniform styles for elements across your site, i.e. the same style for all of your buttons, forms, galleries etc.
A way to add custom CSS to your website
The only way to style regions

All but four of Upfront’s 16 elements can be given preset styles. Which ones can’t you apply presets to?
You can choose to reset or delete a preset you created.
Where can you apply custom CSS in Upfront?
To add custom CSS for elements, click the Edit Preset CSS button under the Appearance tab.
You can choose to add custom CSS or style a preset with the available options, but not both.

page_description:
O:8:"stdClass":3:{s:6:"page_1";s:1463:"

With the Upfront Builder, you can create your very own WordPress themes from scratch without touching a single line of code.

You know that website you've always wanted to build but haven't? Or that theme you've been searching everywhere for, like, ever? Well, now you can build that theme with Builder.

Drag and drop, scale, position, customize and see every edit you make to your website as you make it in real-time with Upfront and Builder.

With the Upfront Builder plugin, you can create beautiful responsive layouts and even save and export them to use on other WordPress websites for lightning fast development. No more migration headaches!

From proof-of-concept design and fully functioning client mockups to polished deliverable themes, Upfront Builder is the only platform you need.

[pic_full_screen ]

[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="1364"] The Upfront Builder interface isn't all that different from the Upfront starter theme interface – though you do get to start building your themes with a blank slate.[/caption]

[/pic_full_screen]

You need to achieve an 80% score in order to pass and move on to the next unit in the course. questions.question: Builder is a:

answers: Both a theme and a plugin
Plugin that is used with Upfront

questions.question: You can install Builder through the WPMU DEV Dashboard plugin.
With Builder, you can: (select all that apply)

answers: Accurately predict the next winner of any sport's game
Create a new Upfront theme from scratch

questions.question: How do you access Builder settings?

answers: By clicking on the Upfront button in the admin tool bar
Staring at the screen long enough for it to open with your sheer force of will.

questions.question: How do you create a new theme in the Builder settings?

answers: By going into the Builder editor and selecting the Create a New Theme button at the top of the menu
By choosing a pre-existing theme from the list
By typing in a name for your theme in the text box toward the top, then clicking the Start Building button

questions.question: Builder's menu is the exact same as the Upfront menu.
Clicking which button lets you access a lightbox to choose a page type to create:
How are the Media and UI / Sprites buttons different in Builder?

answers: The Media button lets you upload images only for your site and UI / Sprites lets you upload images to package with your theme
The Media button lets you upload images to package with your theme and the UI / Sprites button lets you upload images only for your site
Trick question! They're the exact same thing so I can pick the one I like best
The Media button is for images that are stored on the internet and the UI / Sprites button is for images that are stored in my site's Media Library

questions.question: You can't access Responsive Mode in Builder.
The Draggable Elements and Theme Settings tab are the same in Upfront and Builder.

answers: Both a theme and a plugin
